item.description:
Powder Mill Pond is a very beautiful, scenic, sparsely developed, 419 acre shallow lake located in Greenfield and Bennington NH. Powder Mill features numerous coves to explore, an old railroad trestle, a wooden covered bridge, great bass fishing, and an entire fleet of Blue Herons! This shallow lake sees very little powerboat traffic, making it a great paddling destination. Powder Mill Pond is featured in the AMC's “Quiet Waters” paddling guide. While it is a bit of a drive to get there, it is New Hampshire's best kept paddling secret and the drive is well worth it!

For More Information About Powder Mill Pond: http://www.wildlife.state.nh.us/Fishing/bathy_maps/powdermill_hancock.pdf

http://calmwaterpaddler.blogspot.com/2008/09/powder-mill-pond.html

This paddle is open to all Kayak Types as well as Canoes and will be 10-11 miles in length. There are several places to stop and take a break, so pack a lunch/snack and bring plenty of water. After the paddle we will stop somewhere for a post paddle dinner, if you wish to join us bring some $$$!

Life Jackets (PFD's) are always required when paddling with this group!

Directions From The Seacoast:

Take route 4 to 393 West. Take the last exit to I 93 South. Exit onto I 89 North Take Exit 5 to Route 202/9 (Exit is on the Left!) Follow Route 202 West for about 23 ½ Miles Take a Left onto Forrest Road – Greenfield State Park. Follow Forrest Road for about 1 Mile to the Covered Bridge, the put in is on the right immediately after the covered bridge.

For The Technology Obsessed - GPS Coordinates For The Powder Mill Pond Launch: North 42 Degrees. 57 Minutes, 20.5 Seconds West 071 Degrees, 56 Minutes, 11.9 Seconds
item.name: Powder Mill Pond
